question:
Recently, the grand anointing ceremony called Mahamastakabhisheka of Bahubali Gomateshwara statue was celebrated on Vindhyagiri hills in Shravanabelagola. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. Mahamastakabhisheka an important Jain festival held once in every 12 years
  2. Bahubali was one of the 24 Jain Tirthankaras
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: <u>First statement is correct</u>. Mahamastakabhisheka an important Jain festival held once in every 12 years. This ceremony is an integral part of the ancient and composite Jain tradition. <u>Second statement is incorrect</u>. Bahubali was not a tirthankaras. He was the son of Rishabhadeva and Sunanda Devi. He meditated in the “kayotsarga” posture to attain “Keval jnana” and became the first person to achieve Siddha (salvation also known as Moksha).
